page.title: 04FARMING ON ALSTON MOOR (2)
page.content: COWS. Dairying, and rearing of Suckler cows,is practised on Alston Moor. The popular breed of dairy cow is the {Friesian}but there is a good herd of {Ayrshires.}The usual herd size is about sixty but sometimes there are as many as eighty or more in a herd. Suckler cows usually calve around March or April but the dairy herds are normally calving all year round. The most popular bull is the Charolais because it gives good meat calves and they fatten quite quickly.The breeds of Suckler cows are crosses of Friesian and{Aberdeen Angus}or Friesian and{Hereford}but there can be many crosses with different types of cows or bulls.There are some farmers who use A.I. but most have their own bulls because it is cheaper in the long run.
